docs.text: after 1993's " falling down , " i hoped that joel schumacher would mature into a great director .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: since then he has offered us two so-so adaptations of john grisham novels ( " the client " and " a time to kill " ) and two batman movies that lowered the standards of that franchise .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: although these disappointments dampened my enthusiasm for schumacher's potential , the publicity for his latest release , " 8mm , " raised new hope .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it promised to be something unusual .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: it wasn't .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot goes like this : tom welles ( nicolas cage ) is a private eye who is hired by a wealthy woman , allegorically named mrs . christian ( myra carter ) , to investigate an 8mm movie found among her late husband's belongings .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the movie appears to be a snuff film in which a teenage girl is raped and murdered by a man in a leather mask ( who reminds me of bane in schumacher's " batman & robin " ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: because murders can be realistically simulated in movies , mrs . christian wants tom to discover if the girl is alive or dead .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: by combing through missing persons reports , tom finds the girl's name and tracks her to los angeles .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: with the aid of max california ( joaquin phoenix ) , a video store clerk ( and another symbolic name ) , tom wanders through the underworld of pornography in search of snuff .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: the plot bears an obvious resemblance to paul schrader's " hardcore , " in which a father goes deeper and deeper into the industries of porn and sex to find his missing daughter .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: both films are modeled on dante's " the inferno , " of course ; " 8mm " makes that connection overly obvious by casting max as virgil and having him constantly tell tom that they were heading toward a meeting with the devil .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " hardcore " is a much more subtle and meaningful film .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " 8mm " had a lot of promise .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in its better moments it's an examination of violence as entertainment and of the beast within even a nice guy like tom .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: one moment of the first sort : when we first meet max he's reading truman capote's " in cold blood " underneath the cover of a porn novel .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: " in cold blood " was the father of the true-crime genre , which is the literary equivalent of snuff films .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: max promises that we will see examples of the second theme when he tells tom , " dance with the devil and the devil don't change ; the devil changes you . "
docs.label: negative

docs.text: tom does change-i'll let you discover the specifics for yourself-but not permanently .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: schumacher and screenwriter andrew kevin walker didn't have the guts to take tom so far down the dark tunnel that he couldn't come back .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: ( walker's " seven " did a much better job on that theme by refusing to compromise ) .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: cage tries hard to pull it off , but the script doesn't give him enough to work with .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: phoenix walks away with the movie-he's smart , charming , and funny .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: other cast members include " fargo " 's peter stormare camping it up as porn auteur dino velvet and " the sopranos " 's james gandolfini as a soulless porn merchant who pushes tom too far .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: in the last analysis , since " 8mm " falls short of its pretensions and its promise , its just another private eye story in the raymond chandler/ross macdonald tradition of having the detective uncover the depravity behind the glossy facade of wealth and privilege .
docs.label: negative

docs.text: however , unlike other predictable fare in the genre-last year's " twilight , " for example- " 8mm " is especially disappointing because it could have been much more than it is .
docs.label: negative
